sentences: Ei tema mõtle sugugi, ütleb kõik välja, mis sülg suhu toob.
Mees ei parista kunagi seda välja, mida sülg suhu toob. Enne on tarvis ikka kaaluda ja mõelda kah.
translation: what comes out of one's mouth without thinking
blurts out whatever comes into one's head
context: The Estonian word 'toob' is used in the phrase 'mis sülg suhu toob' which literally means 'what spittle brings to the mouth'. This idiom describes speaking without thinking, blurting out whatever comes to mind spontaneously and without consideration of consequences. It refers to unfiltered speech that脱口而出 (comes straight from the mouth) without reflection or forethought.
